measured_by: 101-point recommendation rating scale in the decision task
justification: "Participants were presented with a verbal or numerical probability ... and asked to rate how much they would recommend this treatment to the friend, using a scale labeled 'not at all' on the far left and 'absolutely' on the far right."

measured_by: Membership-function ratings across 11 probability values (multiple-stimuli method)
justification: "Participants were presented with a single verbal probability ... and 11 probability values ... and asked to rate the degree (membership value) to which the verbal probability described each probability using a scale labeled 'not at all' ... 'absolutely'."

measured_by: Direct numerical translation task (entering a number 0–100 %)
justification: "We conducted a numerical translation task wherein participants were asked about the probability that the verbal probability represented, that is, provide a number (0-100%)."

measured_by: Phrase-choice task selecting one of 16 positive or negative expressions
justification: "Participants were asked to choose the phrase out of 16 that would be the most appropriate to convey the probability of treatment effectiveness."
construct: Directionality preference in verbal probability communication

measured_by: Estimated α and β parameters of a Beta distribution via Decision-by-Belief-Sampling (DbBS) hierarchical Bayesian modelling
justification: "We estimated the two parameters, α and β, of the beta distribution, whose CDF best explained the response data based on the hierarchical Bayesian parameter estimation method."
